website_summaries.verdict: Lightweight binoculars that are ideal for using outdoors, especially in low light.
pros: Easy to focus for a crisp image
Sturdy construction that can withstand a few falls
cons: A few customers have complained about chromatic aberration issues

customer_reviews.title: Good mid range glasses
customer_reviews.text: Nice and clear but magnification not as strong as expected. Good balance and nice and light. Nice size to handle.
customer_reviews.author: RIchard J Ranelli

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed. Returned
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed with these 8x42 vanguard endeavors. Lots of good reviews. Guess I got the odd lemon. Was not impressed with the overall quality of the optic on initial inspection. It really got bad when I tried to focus these binoculars. Left side had a blurry circle in the middle of the image. Could focus the image around the blurry spot and the right side. Returned them and bought the bushnell legend 10x42 m series. BUY THE BUSHNELLS. Better quality and image.
customer_reviews.author: MomVo

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I'm comparing these to a much more expensive Nikon Monarch 7 8 x 30. The Vanguards are almost half the price. The Monarch's are a little bit brighter and a little bit sharper. However, the difference is not that much. The Vanguard's are heavier too and the focusing ring isn't as smooth. If you are on a budget you can't go wrong with these binoculars. If you want a better glass, smaller foot print and more light go with the Nikon.
customer_reviews.author: Traderfjp

customer_reviews.title: Excellent binoculars - Great Value.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this binocular for five years now. No problems with it. Very solid, great images, bright and easy to use. I used it when wearing my contact lenses and my glasses. The design makes it easy no matter what I was wearing. I had been using my Nikon Sports 10x50 binoculars and the Vanguard is much superior to the Nikon in all respects even though it was 8x42 and not 10x50. The weight is fairly light and the size is very streamline making this binocular well suited for travelling. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Hank Sue

customer_reviews.title: These looked like nice binoculars at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Well, I got suckered again. These looked like nice binoculars at a great price, after a $100 rebate. Normally I never buy products with rebates, figuring I'm just going to get shafted, but I took a chance, and sure enough I was right. Three months later, still no rebate, as I should have known up front. Decent binoculars, but beware you may be paying full price for them. I wouldn't have.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Lockhart

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed. I had two issues. The subject image required 1) a very precise focus and 2) was not as clear as expected. These ED 1042's do not have much depth focus forgiveness relative to my other binocs-nikon, tasco, bushnell, celestron, and zhumel. The final image clarity was not as clear as my Monarch 5 binocs. I realize these (ED 1042) are more economical than the Monarch 5's and we are not comparing on equal basis. On all other issues, the ED 1042's, were fine. I did return the pair for refund and there were no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as a gift for my girlfriend for birding. I was going to buy a pair of Bushnells but I read a review on the pair I was going to buy (comparing the Bushnells to these Vanguards) and decided to go with the Vanguard pair. Glad I did! I bought them on sale and Vanguard was offering a $100 rebate (which I received very promptly). What a deal! These binos are super clear and bright. I wish I had bought a second pair for myself. I will definitely be purchasing more Vanguard products in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Adam B.

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: Excellent binocular. Well constructed. Great optics. Easy to use. Just a little bit on the heavy side, but I could not justify the extra cost to end up with the same great optics and a few ounces lighter.
customer_reviews.author: PJ O'Connor

customer_reviews.title: Second pair not bad
customer_reviews.text: First pair arrived broken... left eye wouldn't focus. I returned them and got a second pair, which do work well but after a week the adjustable eye cap got jammed in the highest position. I managed to get it fixed after five min of fiddling. Overall I am satisfied with the second pair. The amount charged for these fluctuates wildly, so watch out. I got mine for 2 oo but they day before and after they were 1 oo more.
customer_reviews.author: TDPM

customer_reviews.title: Love the binocs; hate the strap
customer_reviews.text: These binocs are very good. I bought them so I could birdwatch and not have to take my glasses off all the time. My negative experience came from trying to attach the strap. The diagram is so tiny--- and basically useless. I got the strap onto the binocs but I have lots of black lanyard hanging so maybe I didn't do it right. It took me 30 min and a You Tube video. Seriously, guys? You can't make it easier?
customer_reviews.author: JLC

customer_reviews.title: Bright and sharp view with 10x Zoom
customer_reviews.text: What do I miss in this amazing Binocular is eye caps, which covers eye from external light coming from sides, may be asking for more but I felt its must to use in bright day under sunlight. View is very sharp, everyone should adjust two wheel to get a sharp view as each eye sight is different. I felt it has enough zoom, 10x, for my occasional viewing. Night views are wonderful as well, mostly moon. I can't really compare, as I only have one pair.
customer_reviews.author: Pavan Kumar Kora

customer_reviews.title: Loved these more than Vortex brand
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pair of binoculars based on a review from another customer that compared them to Vortex brand binos. My husband lost his whole pack full of all his hunting gear last year and really misses the Vortex binoculars he had. I did not want to spend that kind of money (about $500) on something he only uses once a year. I shop around. What better place to do that than on Amazon? Anyway, long story short, He got these as a gift and absolutely loves them! Some of the features these have the more expensive ones didn't. I really think this company will be the next big thing with the quality of their products.
customer_reviews.author: goodgurl

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with the quality for birding!
customer_reviews.text: I've been a birder since the early seventies and owned a number of binoculars, most recent was a set of Kowa, which were very nice with a major drawback, close focus was terrible! Heading to Southeastern Arizona for a birding trip I decided to get a new pair. Did research and found Vanguard which I'd never heard of before, reviews were excellent and I was impressed by the high end features so made the decision. Happy to say I'm very pleased! Really good clarity, color, and comfortable to use. Close focus is about six feet which is so great after the Kowa. I can't imagine a $2500 set of Swarovskis would be so much better.
customer_reviews.author: TBW

customer_reviews.title: I bought it based on reviews and thought it would be totally awesome, compared to my 35 year old $30 Bushnell ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this almost a year ago. I bought it based on reviews and thought it would be totally awesome, compared to my 35 year old $30 Bushnell Ensign, but there isn't much difference in sharpness to warrant the price of the Vanguard. It is pretty heavy too. I prefer the Bushnell eyepiece that fits snug around your eyes, to block out outside light. I would like to have returned the Vanguard, but I waited too long. Well, anyway, they should last me a lifetime. Maybe they are good for someone who throws them into a duffel bag and piles heavy things on it without worry?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great pair of binoculars, especially for the price at the time I paid.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Vanguard 10x42 ED Glass Binoculars after a co-worker brought his in to show how well these were built. Clear visuals through the lenses, even in low light situations, and better than some more expensive binocs that I've used, and well designed in operation features. The neck strap easily interchanges between the binocs and the pouch, the lense covers are simple yet well made, the eyecups are comfortable and easy to find the adjustment detents, and the focus is fast without being twitchy. They feel solid and comfortable in-hand without being heavy or bulky.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality! Great Price! Great for those who wear eyeglasses!
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a good binocular to use while hunting so I purchased these because of the reviews and of course the rebate that was being offered at the time of purchase. I am not disappointed one bit. best pair of binoculars I have ever used for the price. Great in low light and the color is great. I wear glasses and needed a binocular with good eye relief and these worked perfectly. Images are crisp and clear. Highly recommend to anyone who wears glasses. Great quality! Great Price!
customer_reviews.author: Neil R Bilby

customer_reviews.title: Well made binoculars
customer_reviews.text: I like the open bridge design, which makes for a vey comfortable grip. The locking diopter ring is a really nice touch. These are the first pair of ED glass binocs I've used, so I can't compare to other models. I definitely notice a difference in clarity from an older Pentax set. I am impressed with the build quality. Within a few hours of getting them, I dropped them from a height of 5' onto a hard tile over concrete floor. They bounced once or twice. I cringed, expecting to hear shattered glass when I picked them up, but they were in perfect shape.
customer_reviews.author: S. Burns

customer_reviews.title: Sweet!
customer_reviews.text: It is true, you pay for what you get. These cost a bit more than other binos, yet the reasoning of pay more now to save in the long term I think applies as these are truly sweet. Very clear, easy to use, happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Solus Surfer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my home inspection business
customer_reviews.text: I use these binoculars in my home inspection business to view details on steep roofs and other hard to reach areas near the top of the home. I also wear glasses and the long eye relief is perfect. These binoculars provide a crystal clear, fog free view and I'm able to see every tiny detail, which makes these binoculars vital to my business.
customer_reviews.author: Nick P

customer_reviews.title: Nice all around binoculars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice Binoculars. Feels comfortable in the hand. Solid built. No fault warranty. Sharp and very clear optics during the day and night. Cups attached to the Binoculars on both ends to protect the lens when not in use. Comes with a padded carrying case and nice strap that goes over the shoulder. Focus knob feels tight and smooth when adjusting, the feel of good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Henry E.

customer_reviews.title: Love These Binoculars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice binoculars, got them on sale but still did a lot of research before purchasing. Quality optics and construction. Much less money than the Bushnell's and I think they're easier to hold and focus. I wear glasses and my husband wears contacts and we both find them user friendly. I also have small hands and these felt the best to me. I do need to use the tripod often because they are a little heavy, more than likely due to my shoulder problems than the binos themselves. We've had them over a year now and couldn't be happier with these Vanguards.
customer_reviews.author: Seadollar50

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Binos!!!
customer_reviews.text: I like these binos so much, I bought a second pair. They outperformed Leupold and Bushnell units costing more. I also own the 10.5 X 45's and they are great as well. The clarity is what got me. They are solidly built, come with a nice neck strap and good carry case and lens covers. These binos are fantastic and in my opinion, better than anything in their price range. You will not be disappointed. Anybody that complains about these must have other much more expensive units they are looking through.
customer_reviews.author: Dan M.

customer_reviews.title: Great value and great glass.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a glass 'snob' so I'm not going to try and compare these to Swvarskis. I had a pair of Vortex Diamondback 8 x 42's that I returned - they were shaky at long distances and they fogged up. The lens caps also fell off. I'm very happy with the endeavors - picture is crisper from what I can tell, lens caps are great, little-no fog build up, and the magnification of these with a 32MM objective is much more stable than 8 x42s with seemingly little-no dropoff in magnification. So in summary I like 8x32's better than 8x42's and the Endeavors meeet all my needs at great price and seem better the Vortex Diamondbacks.
customer_reviews.author: jimmylegs

customer_reviews.title: Terrific
customer_reviews.text: I researched this category for a while and these are the best value of quality, lightweight and super super bright clear lens. Recommended by Audubon too.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew J.

customer_reviews.title: Great ROI
customer_reviews.text: Best for the price. Like other folks, I conducted some serious research over time and went for these guys. Yes, they are made in China (always a concern to me) but the other reviewers were not off: it is well-built, it "feels" solid and long-lasting. Now, the optics (while not $1,000) are actually very, very good. I can now do some birding from the comfort of my hammock (yes, "that" lazy). Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rodrigo Silher

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic binoculars
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking for some binoculars for some time, visiting local marine stores and sporting goods stores. A pair that I found good for me always seemed to run $4-500. I'm using these for bird watching, sporting events. As soon as I opened these up, I was amazed! The quality of the image/view was astounding. For the price, I haven't seen anything that will beat these, and I strongly recommend them. Good build quality, protective lens covers, good grip, it's everything you need.
customer_reviews.author: raandomcustomer44

customer_reviews.title: Very good binoculars, great in low light, end caps are the weak thing on this item.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice binoculars, a little stiff to focus below 40 degrees F. End cap loop that held the end cap to the binocular when the cap is removed for viewing, cracked within a few days, then noticed the entire cap missing one day while hunting. I bought replacements from a different manufacturer. Over all, very nice binoculars, even in low light.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Value For The Money
customer_reviews.text: I just got my new pair of Vanguard Endeavor ED 10x42 Binoculars. They are amazing. I'm confused, by how it is possible that any pair bioculars could possibly be better. At under $300 I can't imagine how any pair of binoculars could be 10 times better. These are well worth the money. The images are crystal clear and bright, They focus easily. I'm amazed at the eye relief, and how easy it is to set.
customer_reviews.author: T P Henry

customer_reviews.title: Great eyes!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my son for Christmas. He loves them. He said they are unbelievable! He has hunted his whole life and have used many different brands and said these are by far the best!
customer_reviews.author: ANNE

customer_reviews.title: Best binoculars I've owned
customer_reviews.text: These are great for me because my interpupillary distance (IPD) is around 58 and they fold enough to allow me to see properly. The views are bright. It feels very sturdy. The open bridge design makes them easy to hold. I like that you can lock the right diopter adjustment ring. And the lens caps are well designed so they won't get lost.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Clear vision
customer_reviews.text: These are beautiful binoculars, no color rings, well made, highly recommended. This item came with an $80.00 rebate which has still has not arrived. This does not however take away from the quality of the binoculars.
customer_reviews.author: SteveGord

customer_reviews.title: Great value, Great view!
customer_reviews.text: We bought these based on reviews stating they were nearly as good as high end binoculars costing much more. Compared to a number of cheaper models we've owned, the brightness and clarity of these binoculars are outstanding! We had a problem with the focus wheel failing. Vanguard support was helpful pointing me to a small screw in the focus wheel assembly, which had come loose. I was able to fix it without sending them in for repair. Other than a loose screw, the workmanship seems excellent. We would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen D. Wasson

customer_reviews.title: 10x wide field of view and good eye relief
customer_reviews.text: I am not new to binoculars, being a keen birder and all. These have impressed me a lot for a 10x42 binocular: wide field of view (320ft), good eye relief if you wear spectacles and, most importantly, excellent image. I have no regrets.
customer_reviews.author: jotajota

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Binoculars
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pair of binoculars, and I have must say they are exceptional! I used them for birding, and let me tell you, viewing birds with these is like viewing a bird in your hand! The image is clear and crisp, and the focus nob on the top makes for easy focusing. They come with a case, and very nice rubber caps for both ends. I couldn't be more pleased!
customer_reviews.author: ViciousGnome

customer_reviews.title: Great, Great View; Low, Low Price
customer_reviews.text: Just an excellent instrument. We carry it in our glove compartment, use it often. Better close focus than my Leicas; optics seem the same. What an incredible bargain. 4/29/16 Somehow we broke another pair of Vanguard binoculars. We sent them back to Vanguard for repair. VANGUARD HONORED THEIR WARRANTY! and THEY RETURNED THE REPAIRED BINOCULARS WITHIN A WEEK! UNBELIEVABLE SERVICE. Of course we recommend the company!
customer_reviews.author: Theodore Kobernick

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: We got these as a gift for my father who likes to look at deer on his property in his backyard. He had some friends over and when he was comparing his old binoculars to his new ones his friends were joking around and said that they look like HD binoculars. His friends said that he would rather use those binoculars instead of the scope on his gun. Very nice binoculars they are quality pair. They make for a great gift or for your own personal use.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha & Eric

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! My husband and I have been using the same binos for years. I had no idea what we were missing! We saw these reviewed on a bird watching site and decided to give ourselves a Christmas present. So glad we did.
customer_reviews.author: Basking in Maine

customer_reviews.title: Simply Excellent and a Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Like everyone else, I'm amazed at the sharpness and clarity of these binoculars. This is my first set of medium expensive binoculars, but for the price (and yes, I hate to mention this to others, but I did get them on an Amazon "deal", so it was $200, less the $50 rebate), this has got to be the best combination of economy and quality product out there. 'Props' to the manufacturer for a good product and good quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Alsand

customer_reviews.title: Very good, very clear optics
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for bird watching. Positive: Image very bright when compared to Bushnell 8x42 I have been using Image focus and clarity of detail is extremely good all across the view e as opposed to becoming out of focus at the edges as with some binoculars Relatively light weight and easy to carry on extended hiking trips Focus adjustment changing is fast Rugged construction (so far) Negative None so far
customer_reviews.author: Dayner

customer_reviews.title: the image is awesome. low light ability is great too
customer_reviews.text: a little heavier than expected, the image is awesome. low light ability is great too. i took mine on a safari to kenya and they made a real difference.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Baumann

customer_reviews.title: On sale it was best deal for good quality product!
customer_reviews.text: Well, there was a special XMas holiday deal AND a 100$ rebate in 2013 which brought this pair down to <150$. Needless to say that for that price it is excellent. We use it to carry on hikes for bird/animal spotting and that is good. I know there are a lot better binoculars out there, but if you like to spend 500-3000 dollars than you probably turned this into your main hobby...
customer_reviews.author: Bear grills survival gerber

customer_reviews.title: Built like a tank, and clarity to match.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality and supreme viewing. Sturdy construction and a good feel in the hands. I wear glasses and now see more via the eye relief of these Vanguard Endeavor ED's 8x42, then I did with my old Nikon 10x50. Was well worth the price. Would of enjoyed a more detailed manual however with finer tips and instructions about adjusting the binoculars to different vision needs. Looking forward to years of use in the field birding with these.
customer_reviews.author: BirdingChef

customer_reviews.title: Happy first time Vanguard customer!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, these are fantastic. There are several reviews of people with CA problems but ours does not. They are clearer and brighter than my Nikon Monarchs, and just as enjoyable to look through as my Zeiss Conquests. Everything feels well made, time will tell. Very comfortable to hold, and has very smooth focus wheels and eye cups. They are not heavy either, at least not if you have ever held any brand of 10x42's! I could not be happier with these at this price!
customer_reviews.author: jon

customer_reviews.title: From the deer stand
customer_reviews.text: Writing this review from the deer stand. Outstanding product for the price. My Dad has the Liapould Acadia BX2 and theses are just as good. What swayed me to these was the no hassle warranty, hopefully I won't need it. Quick focus, HD quality optics. Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: bryanr12

customer_reviews.title: Nice binos for the price
customer_reviews.text: These binos give a sharp, bright image. The long eye relief is great for me as I wear glasses. In addition to the high optical quality, they have some nice features such as permanently-attached lens caps (so they can't get lost) and a neck strap that can be used on either the binos or on the case. They seem to have a permanent discount, so I am basing my 5-star review on the actual selling price, not the higher list price.
customer_reviews.author: D. Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Look for a sale, then buy
customer_reviews.text: Terrific clarity and value. I was using while hunting the last two weekends and these are a superb add to your basic gear for a price that won't cause you to leave them at home. I was amazed at the resolution they afforded as I looked at groves of trees up to two miles away. Also, they allowed me to identify flying ducks clearly at 400 yards.
customer_reviews.author: faeroe

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic optics for a great price
customer_reviews.text: I really like the quality feel of this binocular. The grip, coating, weight, case, rubber eye cups and everything else attest to it's quality. But it's the excellent optics that really make these stand out. The image viewed through them is clear and crisp. Focusing is easier than other binoculars I've tried. All-in-all, I am very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: GeraldM

customer_reviews.title: Really nice quality at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Really nice quality at a reasonable price. Use them for bird watching and the field of vision is wide enough that you can follow them when they take off, unlike the smaller glasses where once they take wing, it's just about impossible to get them back in range before they're gone.
customer_reviews.author: MN Mom

customer_reviews.title: He loved them!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these after much research as a gift for my fiancé. I knew nothing about binoculars and really took a chance on these and hit pay dirt! Seeing the surprise on his face when he unwrapped this gift was priceless. He stated these were much better than the ones he had planned on purchasing himself. He gave them 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Reggi

customer_reviews.title: Vanguard Endeavor ED 1042 Binocular, 10x42 .Nice
customer_reviews.text: Nice and clear, I thought they had too much ca for me and sold them to my brother. The last 3 times I looked at them at my bros house I could not see the ca in them, and I looked hard. Impossible binoc to beat for the price.
customer_reviews.author: greg m

customer_reviews.title: The only negative side to these amazing binoculars is that they are a little heavy
customer_reviews.text: The only negative side to these amazing binoculars is that they are a little heavy. I got a back strap and that solved that! The quality of the image in low light is quite incredible, so is stability and durability. I would highly recommend this; extremely good value and a great pair of binoculars for birding.
customer_reviews.author: Lamski

customer_reviews.title: Fine binoculars
customer_reviews.text: Image is a little bit brighter and slightly sharper than my 8x32 Bushnell Trophy XLT binoculars. The difference is subtle, but these are better. The only minor issue I have is my interpupillary distance is 56 mm and just a tad small for these binoculars. Although, I can still see one image, I just wish I could reduce the pupillary distance a little more.
customer_reviews.author: Milton Yee

customer_reviews.title: Vanguard Endeavor ED Binocular (8X42) Are Really Nice!
customer_reviews.text: What an awesome pair of binoculars. Good in low light and have attached lens covers. The clip on the case was broken when I got it, so I called the company and they promptly sent a new case. I love that it is an American company (Michigan, USA). I got a great price and a $50 rebate to boot! Thanks for having your products on Amazon.com Vanguard!
customer_reviews.author: Donald Grasser

customer_reviews.title: These are pretty awesome binoculars
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty awesome binoculars. I've never had a good set before, and I'm glad I purchased these. I was out satellite hunting in Las Vegas and I saw quite a few; as well as looking for animals in the high desert. Great glass, good magnification. Very happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: Ravenhurst

customer_reviews.title: Great binoculars
customer_reviews.text: I'd been researching binoculars for a month, looking in the $150-$250 range in price. I looked mostly at Bushnell brands, but these are much better. They are very clear even at great distances. I find them easy to focus. The neck strap is really comfortable, which is great for long birding trips. They not only look durable, they feel really durable, I hope they last as long as they look like they will.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great binoculars, easy to adjust
customer_reviews.text: Great binoculars, easy to adjust. Very clear, I like the locking ring on the right eyepiece. Three minor comments; would appreciate more information in the instruction manual. Second, the case won't hold the binoculars with the cord on. And last, the cap for the eyepieces is loose, and has to be attached using the cord or something else, or will be easily lost. All in all, I highly recommend them. Rebate received very promptly, in about a week.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great binoculars!
customer_reviews.text: These binoculars are fantastic! Clear all the way to the edge, let lots of light in, comfortable to use. A little bit heavy to take backpacking (or even day hiking), but that's the ONLY downside! And a great value when Amazon puts these on sale.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hermann

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Quality & Value
customer_reviews.text: I had my eyes on these (figuratively speaking) for quite some time, but never pulled the trigger. I finally purchased them as a recent Gold Box deal. I am completely satisfied. Quality optics, construction, and features at a reasonable price. I can't wait to get out in the field and put these to good use.
customer_reviews.author: Emenee

customer_reviews.title: Finally, binoculars that I can actually use with both eyes open!
customer_reviews.text: I use these at my job. High quality optics. Eye relief works great. I HATED binoculars, but I have FINALLY found binoculars that I can actually use and they work great. I have to extend the eye cups to use them, but I do have a single vision field of view, not that double vision or big black spot that I used to always get.
customer_reviews.author: NJLocoman

customer_reviews.title: Binoculars are a great value at $239
customer_reviews.text: Binoculars are a great value at $239. After a $100 rebate they are a steal. Images are very clear, light gathering is really strong and binoculars seem to be well built. Very happy with this purchase. I would definitely recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: David T.

customer_reviews.title: These are great glass for what i paid
customer_reviews.text: These are great glass for what i paid, Io would now buy the EDII as they are amazing for the $$$. Vanguard is the best you have never heard about. I use mine for hunting deer and elk they function well in low light and have replaced my leuopy's for everything except rainforest elk as they are overkill.
customer_reviews.author: SLorenz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent binoculars - worth way more than price.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an expert on binoculars, but these are everything that I wanted as a decent pair. Extremely clear view, very easy to bring up and find what you are trying to view. They work very well with glasses and focus in to a few feet. Very handy optics covers that stay attached to the binoculars or strap. Lifetime total warranty for any problems - even owner-caused can't be beat - just pay small postage and handling fees.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Johnson

customer_reviews.title: great viewing glasses
customer_reviews.text: great viewing glasses, but pretty heavy and bulky, why no one makes any really good true compact binoculars.. have a pair of old bushnell compact that cant be beat. come on vanguard go bye an old pair and copy them if you must...
customer_reviews.author: whichdoctor

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Well after using these all summer and fall I can say the reviews I read are right. These are great binoculars for the price. Even if you spend double the money, you will not do better. Now some of the $1000.00 plus gear, yes, but not for less than that. Very clear immage, sharp and accurate. Perfect for birds and wild life.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo 47

customer_reviews.title: Optics are great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Optics are great for the price. The price was excellent since I got them on one of those Amazon "Deal of the Day" offers. Waterproof is a great advantage and they are sturdy. What are the cons? They are not light.
customer_reviews.author: Love2Read

customer_reviews.title: Trust the high ratings. These are the best for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I got this for my husbands 75 birthday who was checking one thing off his bucket list: a driving trip to Alaska with his brother. When he opened the gift he said he already had binoculars. But this pair had the highest rating, and I told him to give them a shot. I keep getting messages from him. They are Soo clear, he says. I can spot the bears, the whale pods, the eagles way before my brother. The rating was accurate and the money well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Monarch butterfly

customer_reviews.title: Great binoculars
customer_reviews.text: These binoculars are amazing. Extremely clear and crisp viewing. I am not a glass expert but I do love these and would rank them better than the vortex.
customer_reviews.author: UltimateReviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought these at the start of an Ornithology class, knowing that it may pay off to spend a bit extra and not have to upgrade soon. They're easily as clear as my father's Leupold 10x50's, with little to no visible chromatic aberration (fringing). The build is equally solid, and the easily adjustable eye relief cups are a boon to glasses-wearers like myself. Anyone shopping for a good, long-lasting pair of binoculars, look no further!
customer_reviews.author: Tucker Rowlinson

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Binoculars
customer_reviews.text: I use it to watch the wildlife in the lake by our home...Alligators, cool birds, herons. Blad Eagles...It is wonderful...Very easy to adjust and really magnifies....
customer_reviews.author: Bird lady Pat

customer_reviews.title: Nice glass for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great glass for the price! These have allowed me to see far more detail while competing in 3D archery than my previous Vortex ever did. Very happy with these for the price and have no plans to upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: SMH

customer_reviews.title: Purchased them while on sale and with a rebate so very happy with the value
customer_reviews.text: I've had them almost a year. Purchased them while on sale and with a rebate so very happy with the value. I take these on bird walks with people that have some pricey binoculars, I seem to able to see all the details they see. I have narrow eyes and have these as close together as they get. Husband has the 10x42 Endeavors and his do not get narrow enough for me. I noticed Vanguard does not post the interpupillary distance on their binoculars.
customer_reviews.author: Anzie

customer_reviews.title: I had no idea that binoculars could be this good!
customer_reviews.text: We have had binoculars in the house for about 30 years, that my husband got as a gift. We always used them on vacations. I bought these for him because of the amazing deal, and we are amazed that we can see so far, and so clearly through them. It is really remarkable what a difference! I guess the technology has improved from 30 years ago! Ha! I should have purchased something like this sooner. We will be using these a lot this year, on our vacations, but also for back-yard hawk viewing on the tree tops!
customer_reviews.author: chrisdono

customer_reviews.title: Clearly a good value.
customer_reviews.text: Used these on vacation to Alaska. And were quite good in bringing the wildlife up close and personal. There are more powerful binoculars out there, but you will have to struggle with weight and bulk. These at around 2 pounds are lite enough not to weigh your neck down in between uses, and fit in your hands comfortably and securely. My wife and I wear prescription glasses and enjoyed the soft rubber eye pieces that helped with viewing and didn't scratch our lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Bullard

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my trip to Africa. Was very happy to use it for all the wild life observation. It took me a couple of days to figure out that you should pull-out the ocular's extension rings (if you only read the manual...). Nice and clear field of view, sturdy and durable design. Very useful case. Now my friend wants one of these too!
customer_reviews.author: alxfm

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value and quality.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality for the price. Great for wildlife watching, and does a very nice job with backyard star and moon-gazing. I am not an expert in optics, but the Vanguard ED seem to be well constructed and of high quality materials. The clarity is excellent in high and low light conditions. I paid $199 and am about to send in my $50 rebate for a total of $149. I just don't think you can touch a pair of binocs this nice for anywhere near that price. I consider it a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MelB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent binoculars for the price. They are sharp and bright. What I really love was the customer service. During a bird walk, one of the eye cups fell off and was lost. I contacted customer service to purchase a replacement. They sent a replacement for free. I received within a few days. Wow!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew L

customer_reviews.title: Happy Customer
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a pair of binoculars suitable for birding. These fit the bill to a "T". With the current $50 rebate you are looking at $300. I think they are a steal at that price point. I find them to be good with eyeglasses, bright, and sharp almost edge to edge. They are advertised as fog-proof and waterproof. They are comfortable in the hand. Other reviews in binocular web sites that I have seen comment on the relatively shallow depth of field and the short focus range. These points are true but I don't find them to be a real problem.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Weisgram

customer_reviews.title: Great Binoculars for the money!
customer_reviews.text: We've been looking for a nice set of binoculars to watch whales from our beach house deck. My husband wanted a pricey set of Zeiss, but the Zeiss are almost $2k! I don't know if these compare to the Zeiss but for our purposes the Vanguard are perfect. They are clear, bright and easy to focus. The Vanguard are a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda

customer_reviews.title: Clear
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my wife, who is a birder, but she lets me peep through it occasionally. It is dramatically clearer and sharper than our other 8x42 (a small Nikon), with great resolution. I didn't encounter the chromatic aberrations a few report. This is a great optic for birders.
customer_reviews.author: WLS

customer_reviews.title: The image that this binocular produces is nice. However at around 300 yards + there was ...
customer_reviews.text: The image that this binocular produces is nice. However at around 300 yards + there was severe chromatic aberration , I own a pair of $80 Leopold Yosemite Binos that don’t produce the same issue
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: Really  Nice for the Money
customer_reviews.text: I am NOT a professional birder or .... But for looking at animals ,targets when I'm practicing and general scenery when I'm travelling these are many times better than my Bushnell that I used when sailing. Really enjoy the comfortability and the sharpness.
customer_reviews.author: Omega1951

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: Clarity, contrast, smooth operation, quality build; these binoculars have it all. And they come at a reasonable price. I got my wife a pair of the 8X42s a few months ago and I just got the 10X42s for myself. The intensity of color and the brightness in low light conditions certainly impress me. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: aksnagger

customer_reviews.title: Love the Product, don't hesitate to purchase like I did at first
customer_reviews.text: Tempted to buy it the first time under Gold Box Deal. Finally bought it this time with the $50 rebate. It is lightweight and works great. I am enjoying seeing creatures from afar. Not a birdwatcher but will certainly do so as a hobby.
customer_reviews.author: Silvia

customer_reviews.title: A fine value for birding
customer_reviews.text: I am an active birder and I like this binocular very much. I have compared it in the field to some of the very expensive binoculars from companies such as Swarovski and Leitz. I don't think this binocular is quite as good optically as the very best binoculars on the market, but some of those binoculars cost more than 7!! times as much as this one. I think the optics of the Vanguard are very good and the binocular handles very well. The focus and diopter adjustments work great. The eyecups work well for me when I'm wearing eyeglasses. The binocular is a pleasure to hold--it is well-balanced and the armoring material is very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Weatherbird

customer_reviews.title: great product great price.
customer_reviews.text: i am so impressed with this product. I am a photographer and i am a Leica user. i understand colour, contrast and clarity. these binoculars hit all those buttons in spades. these would completely satisfy all but the fusiest and richest user. they are fantastic value. highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Spin

customer_reviews.title: Very Bright Clear View
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pair of binos and they are awesome. What I see is so bright and clear it's unbelievable. I bought these to use while out fishing, but they are a little larger than I thought, plus they are too nice to be banging around the boat. If you buy them, you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Hall

customer_reviews.title: Great Binos!
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the binos. Nice bright crisp image with a reasonably sensitive focus. Also these will work great if you wear glasses. I also have a pair of Nikon Monarch 5 and these are very comparable, although about 20% heavier.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Best Bins for the $$$
customer_reviews.text: I'm not going to rehash everything that was said already, which I have found to be accurate. Here's my take: 1-Absolutely a solid performer in the mid range $450-$750. 2-How much? and a $50 Rebate. 3-Lifetime "No questions asked" warranty. 4-Start the car.
customer_reviews.author: Datiker

customer_reviews.title: Very nice optics & build quality
customer_reviews.text: If had these for 2 months now and like them very well. Very good eye relief, so I can really see through them with my eyeglasses on. Very good build quality, and very smooth adjusting. Great optics also. For the price & quality, I'd buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: WTH

customer_reviews.title: What a difference!!
customer_reviews.text: Not a binocular expert but what a difference!!! Had a pair of nice Bushnell's (or so I thought) but after looking through these the difference was very noticeable. Clear, bright, and comfortable. Excellent purchase and a great price (with the rebate).
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: All that I hoped it would be. My husband loves them for bird watching. Excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: Sparkling clear view
customer_reviews.text: I have several binoculars and spotting scopes. These binoculars have the clearest view of them all. Focusing is very crisp. Actually, I bought these as a gift for someone special. Then I decided to keep them and buy a different gift. Good decision!
customer_reviews.author: Terrence WalshTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: These are really amazing binoculars for the price. Like a lot of people I have a few pairs of cheap travel binoculars lying around, but I've never really tried to use them for subtle outdoor sights like birds. These are so clear, I'm amazed at their price.
customer_reviews.author: Ohdoggy

customer_reviews.title: Great Binoculars at a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I read many reviews before deciding on the Vanguards. I'm really happy with the quality, the construction and performance. I'm a birder and these are perfect for the backyard or for taking on hikes. Focusing is silky smooth. The neoprene neck strap is a nice touch. The company offered a $50 rebate on these at the time I purchased them so for under $300, these binoculars are a great bargain.
customer_reviews.author: K. A. Perlberg

customer_reviews.title: I like this binocular
customer_reviews.text: I like this binocular! I've had many cheaper binoculars and you get what you pay for. My only gripe would be the smallish carrying case, you barely get the strap in.
customer_reviews.author: H. Adkinson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality!
customer_reviews.text: I own 3 pairs of binoculars, now. All highly-rated. These are very clear and easy to love. Adjustments are easy. Nice balance. I found the optics to be very sharp. Beautiful design. And the Rebate that I qualified for during Amazon's Lightning Sale came without a hitch.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Owen

customer_reviews.title: Good, depending on price paid.
customer_reviews.text: If you can get these on sale and then a rebate on top of it, they are well worth it. I have several other pairs, that were in the $50-$100 range, but these are superior to all of them. I think you would have to really get technical and pay far more to beat these.
customer_reviews.author: T.L. Reddish

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought them
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful bins. Of course I only have very bad ones to compare them to but I am happy I bought these. To me they feel good in the hand, the vision is very clear and I like the lock on the ocular. I can actually use them while wearing glasses and I've never been able to do that before.
customer_reviews.author: hali dutroux

customer_reviews.title: Love my Vanguard Endeavor ED Binoculars
customer_reviews.text: When deciding to purchase new binoculars, I read a lot of reviews. The Vanguard Endeavor got such good reviews, I decided to buy them. All I can say is, they are awesome! I especially love how bright the view is when the sun is going down. Everyone that I show these to, are also very impressed with their great clarity. I am so happy that I purchased them, and you will be tool.
customer_reviews.author: sinsheim56

customer_reviews.title: Great Binoculars
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift and my husband is very happy with the clarity and distance these provide. He hasn't left them outside yet to test the seal, but I suspect they will be great!
customer_reviews.author: Inspired E.

product_meta.title: Vanguard Endeavor ED 8x42 Binocular, ED Glass, Waterproof/Fogproof
product_meta.description:
Size:8x42

Vanguard's Endeavor ED binoculars provide nature and outdoor enthusiasts high performance features at an incredible value. Premium ED (Extra-low Dispersion) glass with MultiGuard coatings allow for sharp, bright images and high contrast even in low-light conditions. The ED glass aligns the colors to meet at the same focal plane to reduce the chromatic aberration and obtain the highest resolution and image contrast. As a result, the image is sharper.

Endeavor ED features an ergonomic, open-bridge design that's comfortable to use, along with a lightweight magnesium alloy body, large center focus wheel, and 3 stage twist out eyecups, . Nitrogen-charged and O-ring sealed, the Endeavor ED is water and fog proof to take on challenging weather conditions. Emerald Coating is specifically designed to provide the full spectrum of color within the band of green tones. This coating is essential for nature enthusiasts, because it ensures the most vivid and natural shades of green.

P2 Phase Coating was developed for enhanced image clarity and true color reproduction. Vanguard's P2 phase-coated BaK4 prisms creates crystal clear images and high resolution observation. V-Max Silver Coating provides crisper, more vivid images and sharper contrast due to impressive light reflection. Anti-Reflection Coating on all air-to-surface lenses dramatically minimizes light reflection on the lens. Coupled with fully multi-coated treatment, it ensures near perfect light transmission and image recognition, enabling the brightest images possible, even on the sunniest days.
feature_bullets: ED glass reduces color dispersion to provide high resolution colors & clarity and Bak4 phase-coated prisms with multi-coated lenses
Three stage twist out eyecups with long eye relief, locking diopter ring and lightweight, open bridge body design with large, precise focus wheel
Advanced lens coatings for enhanced light transmission even in low light conditions
Magnification: 8x, Objective Lens Diameter: 42mm, Field of view: 367 ft/1000 yards, View angle: 7.0 degrees, Near focus: 6.6 feet, Eye relief: 19 mm, Weight: 25.8 ounces

specifications.Included Components: Soft-side storage case, Binocular, Lens covers, Lens cleaning cloth, Neck strap
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars616 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
